abstract.p: Albert E Tucher 3rd letter holds Andrew Sullivan's May 21 Way We Live column misses point that if capital punishment is abolished, there will be no more executions but if abortion is abolished, abortions will continue

block.p: Sullivan misses an important distinction between capital punishment and abortion: if the state outlaws capital punishment, there will be no more executions. But if the state outlaws abortion, there will continue to be abortions, more hideous and perhaps even more numerous than those that now occur. I oppose capital punishment. I support legal abortion, not because I rejoice in abortions but because experience tells us that the alternative to legal abortion is much worse.
